```{r setup}
get_age_percents <- function(x, .race = NULL, .cohort = NULL){
  if(is.null(.race) & is.null(.cohort)){
    exposure_ecdf <- ecdf(x$age_right)
    return(exposure_ecdf(1:40))
  } else if (is.character(.race)){
    exposure_ecdf <- ecdf(x$age_right[x$race == .race])
    return(exposure_ecdf(1:40))
  } else if (is.character(.cohort)){
    exposure_ecdf <- ecdf(x$age_right[x$cohort == .cohort])
    return(exposure_ecdf(1:40))
  } else {
    stop("If provided, race or cohort must be a character value")
  }
}
gg_color_hue <- function(n) {
```

```{r phdcn-timeline, cache = TRUE}
#| fig.width: 9

df <- tribble(
  ~cohort, ~time, ~year, ~age, 
  0,  1, 1995,  0,
  0,  2, 2021, 25,
  3,  1, 1995,  3,
  3,  2, 2002, 11,
  6,  1, 1995,  6,
  6,  2, 2002, 14,
  9,  1, 1995, 9, 
  9,  2, 2021, 34,
  12, 1, 1995, 12,
  12, 2, 2021, 37,
  15, 1, 1995, 15,
  15, 2, 2021, 40,
  18, 1, 1995, 18,
  18, 2, 2002, 26,
) %>%
  mutate(focus = ifelse(cohort %in% c(0,9,12,15), "yes", "no"))

cs_df <- tibble(
  survey = rep(c("PHDCN-CS", "CCAHS"), each = 7),
  year   = rep(c(1995, 2002), each = 7),
  cohort = rep(seq(0,18, by = 3), length.out = 14)
)
wave_df <- tibble(
  survey = rep(1:5, length.out = 35),
  year   = rep(c(1995, 1998.5, 2002, 2012, 2021), length.out = 35),
  cohort = rep(seq(0,18, by = 3), each = 5)
) %>%
  filter(year <= 2002 | cohort %in% c(0, 9, 15)) %>%
  mutate(group = 
           case_when(
            year <= 2002 ~ year, 
            year > 2002 & cohort %in% c(9,15,18) ~ year,
            year > 2002 & cohort == 0 ~ year -1),
         phdcn = ifelse(year <= 2002, "PHDCN", "PHDCN+"))


ggplot(df, aes(x = year, y = cohort, group = cohort)) + 
   # geom_mark_rect(data = cs_df, aes(group = year), fill = "#00BFC4", color = NA, expand = unit(7, "mm"), ) +
    geom_mark_rect(data = wave_df, aes(group = group, fill = phdcn), color = NA, expand = unit(6, "mm")) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 3, aes(color = focus)) +
  geom_richtext(aes(label = age, fill = focus), 
                size = 5, label.colour = NA, text.color = "black") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 24) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("yes" = "white", "no" = "grey50", "PHDCN" = "#F8766D", "PHDCN+" = "#00BFC4")) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("yes" = "white", "no" = "grey50", "PHDCN" = "#F8766D", "PHDCN+" = "#00BFC4")) +
  labs(y = "Cohort Ages", x= NULL) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1995, 2021, by = 5), limits = c(1994,2022)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-1,22)) +
  
  annotate("text", x = 1998.5, y = 21.25, family = plot_font, label = "Original PHDCN\nWaves 1–3", color = "#F8766D", size = 5) +
  annotate("text", x = 2016.5, y = 21.25, family = plot_font, label = "PHDCN+\nWaves 4 & 5", color = "#00BFC4", size = 5) +
  theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_blank(),
        axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey90"),
        text = element_text(family = plot_font,  color = "white"),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA),
```

... and if so, at what age? [*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;But not at every wave*]{.fragment .fade-in}

Problem: **Interval censoring**

```{r interval-censoring, cache = TRUE}
#| fig.height: 0.9
#| fig.width: 8

tibble(
  Age = c(0, 3, 6, 17, 17, 26),
  red = c("white", "white", "white", "white", "red", "red"),
  `Seen Shot` = c("No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "Yes"),
  y = c(1,1,1,1,1, 1)
) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Age, y = y)) + 
  geom_line(aes(color = red), linewidth = 2) + 
  annotate("text", x = -6, y = 1, label = "Seen Shot", color = "white", size = 7) +
  annotate("text", x = -6, y = 0, label = "Age", color = "white", size = 7) +
  geom_text(aes(x = Age, label = Age, y = y - 1), color = "white", size = 7) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("red" = "red", "white" = "white")) +
  geom_richtext(aes(label = `Seen Shot`), size = 7, label.colour = NA, text.color = "black") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim =  c(-0.7, 1.7), xlim = c(-9, 28), expand = FALSE) +
  theme_void(base_size = 24) +
  theme(legend.position = "none",
        text = element_text(family = plot_font,  color = "white"),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA))
```

## Cohort 15 context {.smaller}

```{r, cache = FALSE}

axis_data <- tibble(cohort = factor(c(0, 9, 12, 15), levels = c(0, 9, 12, 15)),
                          hom_rate = rep(24.8,4),
                          age = rep(-3, 4))
cohort_df <- cohort_age_hom %>%
    mutate(cohort = str_remove(cohort, "Cohort "),
         cohort = fct_reorder(cohort, as.numeric(cohort)),
         cohort = fct_rev(cohort)) %>%
    filter(age %in% c(9, 25)) %>%
    select(cohort, age, year) %>%
    pivot_wider(names_from = age, values_from = year)

timeline_df <- 
  hom_rate_df %>% 
  select(year, gun_hom_rate, disadvantage_spline) %>%
  left_join(il_incarceration) %>%
  select(year,
         `Gun Homicide` = gun_hom_rate, 
         `Disadvantage` = disadvantage_spline, 
         `Incarceration` = incarceration,
         `Arrests`     = arrestrate) %>%
  pivot_longer(-year, names_to = "measure", values_to = "value") |>
  mutate(measure = fct_relevel(measure, 
                              "Gun Homicide", 
                              "Disadvantage",
                              "Arrests",
                              "Incarceration"))

cohort_plot <- function(x){
  out_plot <- timeline_df %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = year, y = value, color = measure)) + 
    geom_line() + 
    facet_wrap(~measure, strip.position = "top", ncol = 2, scales = "free_y") +  
    geom_rect(data = cohort_df %>% filter(cohort == x), aes(xmin = `9`, xmax = `25`), ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf, fill = "white", alpha = 0.3, inherit.aes = FALSE) +
    theme_minimal(base_size = 20) +
    coord_cartesian(clip = FALSE, xlim = c(1980,2021)) +
    labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = "Ages 9 to 25 highlighted") +
    theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),
          axis.text = element_text(color = "white"),
          # axis.text.y.right =  element_blank(),
          axis.text.y.left  = element_blank(),
          panel.spacing.x = unit(2, "cm"),
          plot.caption = element_text(color =  "white", size = rel(0.75), hjust = 0),
          strip.text = element_text(color =  "white", size = rel(1.2)),
          legend.position = "none",
          text = element_text(family = plot_font,  color = "white"),
          panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA),
          plot.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA))
  return(out_plot)
}
```

## Probability by age 28: Cohort {.smaller}

```{r, cache = TRUE}
logit_models <- list(
`Seen shot` = glm(formula = factor(seen_shot_ever) ~ cohort + sex + race + 
    PCA_disadv_09 + hom_rate_avg_09 + collective_efficacy_09 + 
      pcimgen +  ses + pc_relstatus, family = binomial, 
    data = survival_data[["seen_shot"]] %>% filter(w5_sample) |>
      mutate(seen_shot_ever = ifelse(age_right >= 28, "no", seen_shot_ever))),
`Been shot` = glm(formula = factor(been_shot_ever) ~ cohort + sex + race + 
    PCA_disadv_09 + hom_rate_avg_09 + collective_efficacy_09 + 
      pcimgen + ses + pc_relstatus, family = binomial, 
    data = survival_data[["been_shot"]] %>% filter(w5_sample) |>
      mutate(been_shot_ever = ifelse(age_right >= 28, "no", been_shot_ever))),
`Concealed carry` = glm(formula = factor(concealed_carry_ever) ~ cohort + sex + race + 
    PCA_disadv_09 + hom_rate_avg_09 + collective_efficacy_09 + 
      pcimgen + ses + pc_relstatus, family = binomial, 
    data = survival_data[["concealed_carry"]] %>% filter(w5_sample) |>
      mutate(concealed_carry_ever = ifelse(age_right >= 28, "no", concealed_carry_ever))),
`Used gun` = glm(formula = factor(used_gun_ever) ~ cohort + sex + race + 
    PCA_disadv_09 + hom_rate_avg_09 + collective_efficacy_09 + 
      pcimgen + ses + pc_relstatus, family = binomial, 
    data = survival_data[["used_gun"]] %>% filter(w5_sample) |>
      mutate(used_gun_ever = ifelse(age_right >= 28, "no", used_gun_ever))))
```

Method: Semi-parametric proportional hazards MLE (Anderson-Bergman 2017)

## Hazard ratio estimates

```{r hazard-estimates, cache = FALSE}
#| fig.width: 10
#| fig.height: 6
rename_terms_and_outcome <- function(x, type = "default"){
   out_df <- mutate(x, term = 
             case_when(
               str_detect(term, "race") ~ str_replace(term, "race", ""),
               str_detect(term, "sex") ~ "Male",
               str_detect(term, "cohort_0Older Cohorts:whiteWhite") ~ "Older Cohorts x White",
               str_detect(term, "cohort_0Older Cohorts") ~ "Older Cohorts",
               str_detect(term, "white") ~ str_remove(term, "white"),
               str_detect(term, "ses") ~ "SES",
               str_detect(term, "pc_relstatus") ~ paste0("PC " ,str_to_title(str_remove(term, "pc_relstatus"))),
               str_detect(term, "cohort") ~ str_c("Cohort ", str_remove(term, "cohort")),
               str_detect(term, "pcimgen") ~ str_replace(term, "pcimgen", "PC Immig. Gen "),
               str_detect(term, "PCA_disadv") ~ str_c("Tract Disadvantage"),
               str_detect(term, "hom_rate") ~ str_c("Tract Homicide Rate"),
               str_detect(term, "collective_efficacy") ~ str_c("NC Collec. Efficacy"),
               TRUE ~ "ERROR"
           ),
         outcome = str_to_title(str_replace(outcome, "_","\n"))) |>
     mutate(term = fct_rev(fct_relevel(term, 
                              "Cohort 12", "Cohort 9", "Cohort 0",
                              "Male", 
                              "Black", "Hispanic", "Other", 
                              "PC Immig. Gen 2", "PC Immig. Gen 1",
                              "SES", "PC Married", "PC Single"
                              )))
   return(out_df)
}

map_dfr(c("seen_shot", "been_shot", "concealed_carry", "used_gun"), ~ get_spt_estimates(spt_base_models, .x, zval = 1.96)) %>%

              mutate(spec = "Without Neighborhood")) |>
```

```{r predictions-race, cache = TRUE}
breaks_fun <- function(x) {
  if (max(x) > 0.2) {
    c(0, 0.1, 0.2)
  } else if (max(x) > 0.15) {
    c(0, 0.08, 0.16)
  } else if (max(x) > 0.10) {
    c(0, 0.05, 0.10)
  } else if (max(x) > 0.06) {
    c(0, 0.03, 0.06)
  } else {
    c(0, 0.02, 0.04)
  }
}
```

## Rate ratio estimates

```{r nearby-shootings-model, cache = TRUE}
#| fig.width: 9
#| fig.height: 5.5
gva_radius_nb |>
  mutate(spec = "With Disadvantage") |>
  bind_rows(gva_radius_nb_noneighb |> mutate(spec = "Without Disadvantage")) |>
  mutate(term = 
           fct_rev(fct_relevel(term,
             "Male", 
             "Race Black", "Race Hispanic", "Race Other", 
             "Age",
             "Tract Disadvantage"
             ))) |>
  mutate(across(c(estimate, conf.low, conf.high), ~exp(.))) |>
   ggplot(aes(x = estimate, y = term, group = spec, color = spec)) + 
    geom_vline(xintercept=1, linetype = "dashed", alpha = 0.8, size = 0.5, color = "grey80") +
    geom_point(size =1.5, position = ggstance::position_dodgev(height = 0.4)) + 
    scale_x_log10(breaks = c(0.5, 1, 5, 20), labels = c("0.2", "1.0", "5", "20")) +
    geom_errorbarh(aes(xmin = conf.low, xmax = conf.high), size =0.5, height = 0.25, position = ggstance::position_dodgev(height = 0.4)) +
    labs(y = NULL, x = NULL, title = NULL, subtitle = NULL, color = NULL) +
    theme_minimal(base_size = 24) + 
    coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0.5, 20)) +
    theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_text(color = "grey90", family = plot_font),
        strip.text = element_text(color =  "white", family = plot_font, size = rel(1.2)),
        legend.position = "bottom",
        text = element_text(family = plot_font,  color = "white"),
        panel.spacing.x = unit(0.8, "in"),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",colour = NA))
```

::: aside
*Exponentiated negative binomial regression estimates of shootings within 250m*
:::

## Takeaways {background-image="img/joel-mott-s-rsM-AktbA-unsplash.jpg" background-opacity="0.1"}

-   Cohort gun use and exposure to gun violence differ by cohort macrosocial context

-   Stark race and sex differences

-   Individual characteristics more predictive of life-course outcomes than neighborhood context

-   Shootings frequent near residences of black respondents

    -   Only partly explained by local disadvantage

## New questions {background-image="img/joel-mott-s-rsM-AktbA-unsplash.jpg" background-opacity="0.1"}

-   Reproduction of gun violence: Does childhood exposure cause adult gun carrying and use?

-   Is residential proximity to shootings related to...

    -   ... personal exposure to gun violence?
    -   ... awareness of nearby shootings?
    -   ... micro-spatial disadvantage?

-   How often do respondents move to, from, and between between high gun violence neighborhoods?
